intro: Diplycosia puradyatmikae, commonly known as the Malabar thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
